optionalParameters.description: The ConfigID to boot, available from linode.config.list().

methods.description: Issues a boot job for the provided ConfigID. If no ConfigID is provided boots the last used configuration profile, or the first configuration profile if this Linode has never been booted.

mandatoryParameters.description: The LinodeID that you want cloned
The DatacenterID from avail.datacenters() where you wish to place this new Linode
The desired PlanID available from avail.LinodePlans()

optionalParameters.description: Subscription term in months for prepaid customers. One of: 1, 12, or 24

methods.description: Creates a new Linode, assigns you full privileges, and then clones the specified LinodeID to the new Linode. There is a limit of 5 active clone operations per source Linode. It is recommended that the source Linode be powered down during the clone.

mandatoryParameters.description: The DatacenterID from avail.datacenters() where you wish to place this new Linode
The desired PlanID available from avail.LinodePlans()

optionalParameters.description: Subscription term in months for prepaid customers. One of: 1, 12, or 24

methods.description: Creates a Linode and assigns you full privileges. There is a 75-linodes-per-hour limiter.

mandatoryParameters.description: The LinodeID to delete

optionalParameters.description: Skips the safety checks and will always delete the Linode.

methods.description: Immediately removes a Linode from your account and issues a pro-rated credit back to your account, if applicable. To prevent accidental deletes, this requires the Linode has no Disk images. You must first delete its disk images.

optionalParameters.description: Limits the list to the specified LinodeID

methods.description: Returns a list of all Linodes user has access or delete to, including some properties. Status values are -1: Being Created, 0: Brand New, 1: Running, and 2: Powered Off.
Issues a shutdown, and then boot job for a given LinodeID.

mandatoryParameters.description: The desired PlanID available from avail.LinodePlans()

methods.description: Resizes a Linode from one plan to another. Immediately shuts the Linode down, charges/credits the account, and issue a migration to another host server.
Issues a shutdown job for a given LinodeID.

optionalParameters.description: This Linode's label

CPU Alert threshold, percentage 0-800
Enable the disk IO email alert
IO ops/sec
Enable the incoming bandwidth email alert
Mb/sec
Enable the outgoing bandwidth email alert
Mb/sec
Enable the bw quote email alert
Percentage of monthly bw quota
Enable the Lassie shutdown watchdog

methods.description: Updates a Linode's properties.

mandatoryParameters.description: The KernelID for this profile. Found in avail.kernels()
The Label for this profile
A comma delimited list of DiskIDs; position reflects device node. The 9th element for specifying the initrd.

optionalParameters.description: Comments you wish to save along with this profile
RAMLimit in MB. 0 for max.
One of 'default', 'single', 'binbash'
Which device number (1-8) that contains the root partition. 0 to utilize RootDeviceCustom.
A custom root device setting.
Enables the 'ro' kernel flag. Modern distros want this.
Enable the disableUpdateDB filesystem helper
Enable the Xen filesystem helper. Corrects fstab and inittab/upstart entries depending on the kernel you're booting. You want this.
Creates an empty modprobe file for the kernel you're booting.
Automatically creates network configuration files for your distro and places them into your filesystem.
Controls if pv_ops kernels should automount devtmpfs at boot.

The IP Address ID to swap

optionalParameters.description: The LinodeID of the Linode where IPAddressID will be transfered

methods.description: Exchanges Public IP addresses between two Linodes within a Datacenter. The destination of the IP Address can be designated by either the toLinodeID or withIPAddressID parameter. Returns the resulting relationship of the Linode and IP Address parameters. When performing a one directional swap, the source is represented by the first of the two resultant array members.

optionalParameters.description: Limits the list to the specified JobID

mandatoryParameters.description: The DatacenterID from avail.datacenters() where you wish to place this new NodeBalancer

To help mitigate abuse, throttle connections per second, per client IP. 0 to disable. Max of 20.

mandatoryParameters.description: The NodeBalancerID to delete

methods.description: Immediately removes a NodeBalancer from your account and issues a pro-rated credit back to your account, if applicable.

optionalParameters.description: Limits the list to the specified NodeBalancerID

methods.description: Returns a list of NodeBalancers this user has access or delete to, including their properties

optionalParameters.description: This NodeBalancer's label
To help mitigate abuse, throttle connections per second, per client IP. 0 to disable. Max of 20.

methods.description: Updates a NodeBalancer's properties

mandatoryParameters.description: The parent NodeBalancer's ID

optionalParameters.description: Port to bind to on the public interfaces. 1-65534
Either 'tcp', 'http', or 'https'
Balancing algorithm. One of 'roundrobin', 'leastconn', 'source'
Session persistence. One of 'none', 'table', 'http_cookie'
Perform active health checks on the backend nodes. One of 'connection', 'http', 'http_body'
Seconds between health check probes. 2-3600
Seconds to wait before considering the probe a failure. 1-30. Must be less than check_interval.
Number of failed probes before taking a node out of rotation. 1-30
When check=http, the path to request
When check=http_body, a regex against the expected result body
SSL certificate served by the NodeBalancer when the protocol is 'https'
Unpassphrased private key for the SSL certificate when protocol is 'https'
